snippet: From Congress to a major conference of American Jews and other supporters of Israel, President Obama is being buffeted by calls for a more aggressive posture toward Tehran.
abstract: Israel's most powerful American advocates, alongside Republican presidential candidates and members of Congress, are mounting an extraordinary public campaign to pressure President Obama into hardening American policy toward Iran over its nuclear program; advocates, like powerful American Israel Public Affairs Committee, want Obama to be more explicit about the circumstances under which the United States itself would carry out a strike; issue has gained force in the lead up to White House visit by Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu.
lead_paragraph: From Congress to a major conference of American Jews and other supporters of Israel, President Obama is being buffeted by calls for a more aggressive posture toward Tehran.

headline.seo: Israel’s Backers in Aipac Press Obama to Harden Iran Policy
headline.main: U.S. Backers of Israel Pressure Obama Over Policy on Iran
headline.print_headline: Israel's Backers Pressure Obama On Iran Position
